snippet: Borrowing costs approached 6 percent even after the Spanish government announced new budget cuts.
abstract: Spain's borrowing costs approach levels not seen since early January, raising concerns that the financial crisis in Europe is surging following a lull; country is entering its second recession in three years; government says it will continue with the austerity program needed to put Spain back on track for economic growth.

byline.original: By RAPHAEL MINDER and DAVID JOLLY

lead_paragraph: Borrowing costs approached 6 percent even after the Spanish government announced new budget cuts.

headline.main: Spain Bond Yields Rise, Reviving Fears of a Renewed Euro Crisis
headline.print_headline: Spain’s Finances Prompt Fear of Resurging Debt Crisis
